board

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • board.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Cell[] cells 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board()
      Board constructor creates a Board and puts all the pieces in the respective cells the board is ready to start the game
      Board(char teste)
      Board constructor creates an empty board, used in testing

      void printBoard(Piece.color side)
      prints the board to the console Pieces are print using letters: 'K' - King 'Q' - Queen 'B' - Bishop 'N' - Knight 'R' - Rook 'P' - Pawn ' ' - white cell 'X' - black cell
      void printBoardColor()
      prints the board with white always facing the player

      prints the board to a string
      void undoMove()
      undoes the previous move only one move can be undone, before another play needs to be made if a piece was captured in the previous move, the piece is returned to its cell

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public boolean move(int[] initialPos,
           int[] finalPos,
           Piece.color side)
        method move interaction with the outside moves the piece in initialPos to finalPos, if valid
        Parameters:
        initialPos - vetor int[] of the initial position, [0] column, [1] line
        finalPos - vetor int[] of the final position, [0] column, [1] line
        side - side (Piece.color.white ou Piece.color.black) that is playign
        Returns:
        true the piece was moved

      • undoMove

        public void undoMove()
        undoes the previous move only one move can be undone, before another play needs to be made if a piece was captured in the previous move, the piece is returned to its cell

      • checkMoves

        public int checkMoves(Cell cell,
             int[] finalPos)
        checks if the move in finalPos is valid for the piece in cell
        Parameters:
        cell - board cell that contains the piece to be moved
        finalPos - position that the piece is to be moved to
        Returns:
        0 invalid movement, the piece can't move like that

      • checkCheck

        public boolean checkCheck(Cell cellCheck)
        checks if a cell is in check
        Parameters:
        cellCheck - cell to check
        Returns:
        true the cell is in check

      • checkCheck

        public boolean checkCheck(Piece.color attackingSide)
        checks if the opponent is in check
        Parameters:
        attackingSide - color of the player attacking
        Returns:
        true the opponent is in check

      • printBoard

        public void printBoard(Piece.color side)
        prints the board to the console Pieces are print using letters: 'K' - King 'Q' - Queen 'B' - Bishop 'N' - Knight 'R' - Rook 'P' - Pawn ' ' - white cell 'X' - black cell
        Parameters:
        side - side of the board facing the player

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(Piece.color side)
        prints the board to a string
        Parameters:
        side - side of the board facing the player
        Returns:
        board on a string

      • printBoardColor

        public void printBoardColor()
        prints the board with white always facing the player
